alert.note: Alert for Adams; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 11:39AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln, southeastern Jefferson, Franklin, northeastern Adams and Copiah Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1139 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carpenter to near Mcnair to near Natchez. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hamburg around 1145 AM CDT. Dentville around 1150 AM CDT. Kirby and Barlow around 1155 AM CDT. New Hope and Kingston around 1200 PM CDT. Hazlehurst, Bude and Glancy around 1205 PM CDT. Garden City and Mccall Creek around 1210 PM CDT. Martinsville around 1215 PM CDT. Wesson and Little Springs around 1220 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Roxie, Beauregard and Meadville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and central, south central and southwestern Mississippi.
